channel.title: Hazardous Environment Combat Unit
channel.description:
First of all, hi everybody! I've just registered and I'm happy to be here. I think when Black Mesa Source is released, I'll probably enjoy it even more than Half Life 2. :freeman:
I have a small suggestion to make, regarding the HECU. I know that, in the original Half Life, they commonly wear no helmets, berets, or balaclavas with cigars hanging out of their mouths. I find this rather, to put it bluntly, kinda stupid. Their name says "[i]Hazardous Environment[/i]" and the first thing I think of is something like these guys:
![](upload://uprsLo8uql5g0vwhBbuYjN8gBcK.jpeg)
This seems more true to the name, not to mention cooler and more professional looking. In addition, it might fit more with their role as enemies. The Combine Civil Protection and soldiers in HL2 are cool enemies because they're faceless and scary. Black Mesa Source HECU should be like this as well, because of their roles as enemies who invade the research facility. So, I think the majority of them should have at least gas masks, and less typical military gear.

item.title: Hazardous Environment Combat Unit
item.dc:creator: Flatline
item.description:
OrderOfDagon:

Pretty sure the name is just a humorous oxymoron. Probably because it was so big that the name was probably funny.

Um, no. He’s correct. It’s a miniature version of similarly functioning weapons such as the aforementioned M61 Vulcan.

Oh, and the bulletproof jacket comment is erroneous. Miniguns eject their shells downwards so it was unecessary.

Read full topic

item.title: Hazardous Environment Combat Unit
item.dc:creator: Georgy
item.description:
The Bad Guys:

Eh, not really. I forget the actual name - partly because I’m too lazy to google it ATM - but there is a larger version that they put on certain jets and attack helicopters that are about half the size of urban buses. Seriously - the gun is not so much strapped to the plane than it is that the plane is strapped to the gun. In that context, the ‘minigun’ really is a mini gun in comparison.

But still, they’re too big and powerful for one man to fire continuously without the use of supports. The recoil from the things can likely break ribs, cause internal bleeding, severe bruising and possibly even spine damage.

Yeah - any movie that depicts one man wielding these things is full of shit. *coughcoughpredatorcoughcough.

Don’t remember where I saw it, but on the “minigun” in Predator somewhere they showed that they fired blanks (or some special cartridges with less recoil - think it was just blanks though) and the actor firing it wore a bullet proof vest, mainly because the shell casings flew out at such a high velocity that they were dangerous
Don’t remember if I saw a “Making of” or if it was just some gun show…

Read full topic

item.title: Hazardous Environment Combat Unit
item.dc:creator: The_Bad_Guys
item.description:
DrasarSalman:

I like the way a so giant device of ownage (according to games) is called the “minigun”!

Other synonyms may be m61 Vulcan or gartling gun, but I seriously think the “minigun” nickname is some kind of a military practical joke… just like Roswell

Eh, not really. I forget the actual name - partly because I’m too lazy to google it ATM - but there is a larger version that they put on certain jets and attack helicopters that are about half the size of urban buses. Seriously - the gun is not so much strapped to the plane than it is that the plane is strapped to the gun. In that context, the ‘minigun’ really is a mini gun in comparison.

But still, they’re too big and powerful for one man to fire continuously without the use of supports. The recoil from the things can likely break ribs, cause internal bleeding, severe bruising and possibly even spine damage.

Yeah - any movie that depicts one man wielding these things is full of shit. *coughcoughpredatorcoughcough.

Read full topic

item.title: Hazardous Environment Combat Unit
item.dc:creator: Ding
item.description:
DrasarSalman:

I like the way a so giant device of ownage (according to games) is called the “minigun”!

Other synonyms may be m61 Vulcan or gartling gun, but I seriously think the “minigun” nickname is some kind of a military practical joke… just like Roswell

Don’t know if this helps, as I am part of that practical joke, but a minigun uses rifle caliber rounds where as a full fledged gattling uses 20mm or higher.

Read full topic
